intro: Tapura panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian tapura, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
